reason: The node uses notational convention B_0 = {{1,4}, {2,5}, {3,6}} and tuple notation like '({1,4}, {2,5}, {3,6}) -> ({3,6}, {2,5}, {1,4})' but there is no formal definition in scope clarifying whether B_0 is viewed as a set of sets, an ordered tuple, or a partition object. The arrow notation '({1,4}, {2,5}, {3,6}) -> ({3,6}, {2,5}, {1,4})' appears to treat B_0 as an ordered 3-tuple, but the standard definition of partition preservation treats it as an unordered set. This notational ambiguity could mask important mathematical distinctions.
